page.title: 17EDUCATION & SERVICE CHILDREN
page.content:
The education of service children suffers from the necessity of its parents to move at regular intervals of between 18 months and 3 to 4 years. The child has then to readjust to a new home and more importantly to a new school, more often than not in the middle of a term and often in the middle of a week or even day!
Standards vary immensely as a result of the number and quality of schools attended.
Most children are gregarious,outgoing, superficially knowledgeable, capable of holding a succint conversation with an adult.Their sense of humour is also usually immediately obvious _ perhaps an inbuilt defence against the instability of their pattern of home life.
